text: No this is not what I asked. Sorry if it isn't clear. I just want the inline thank you message on form submission to be the inline thank you message set on the form options.
<@U01QVR44MEY> <@UGDF9EBPW> I am sure one of you know.
<@U02PP69P9T8>, I'm currently on a holiday, so I'm not able to share the snippet. But the form events are only accessible through JavaScript, as they are window events

Ok, that is what I thought. Thanks <@UGDF9EBPW>. I don't want to bother on your Holiday but if you happen to have an answer to my first question, that would be much appreciated. Is it possible to fallback to the thank you message set on the form options tab for form in a dnd_module?
I know we have a bit more of options included

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#form>

yep but none seems to be related to any sort of fallback to form options
You can also edit the form options on the page itself instead of the full form editor
Any chance you have a different text on a page level?

Hi everyone,
anyone else facing this error all of a sudden in previously functional custom modules?
`DisabledException: 'module' is disabled in this context`

I have a custom module that has, among other things, a typical `{% set rec_posts = blog_recent_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, 3) %}` in order to loop through and show recent blog posts. If I remove this line, the error will vanish. How come HubSpot is signaling this error out of the blue? The module was made several weeks ago and it has always been perfectly functional. I have to make some changes to the code but I bumped into this error, preventing me from applying any other tweak.
Hey <@U049YGVBGBC> very odd. To work around similar errors I've assigned a new variable using the "<http://module.blog|module.blog>" then pass the new variable into the function.

<@U021JKWA1GB> I tried that too, like this
`{% set test = <http://module.blog|module.blog> %}`
and then
`{% set rec_posts = blog_recent_posts(test, 3) %}`
`{% for post in rec_posts %}`

No difference.
I mean, it's pretty standard stuff, nothing too fancy...
The thing that's striking is that this module was built exactly like it is now and has been working for a few weeks without any problems.
Now this error popped up and I don't know why HS is complaining all of a sudden
